intro: Milium cimicinum, commonly known as the lesser millet, is a small annual grass native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces clusters of small, spikelet-like flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is sometimes used as a forage crop. The seeds are edible and have been used in traditional cuisines in some regions.
